meanings.definition: The act of cleaning or scrubbing a surface.
meanings.sent1: She used gentle scrubbings to clean the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent2: After the party, the floor needed thorough scrubbings to remove all the stains.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to do scrubbings on her toy dishes.
meanings.sent4: His words were like harsh scrubbings, trying to erase her confidence.
meanings.sent5: The sound of scrubbings echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.definition: The residue or remnants left behind after scrubbing.
meanings.sent1: The sink was full of dirty scrubbings after washing the dishes.
meanings.sent2: The cleaner wiped away the scrubbings to reveal a sparkling surface.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the soapy scrubbings left in the tub.
meanings.sent4: The scrubbings on the window showed how hard she had worked to clean it.
meanings.sent5: The scrubbings clung stubbornly to the sponge.

meanings.sent1: She gave the bathtub a deep scrubbings to make it shine.
meanings.sent2: The car wash included a full scrubbings of the exterior.
meanings.sent3: The idea of doing scrubbings on a Saturday morning was not appealing to him.
meanings.sent4: The old building needed a complete scrubbings to look new again.
meanings.sent5: The intense scrubbings removed all traces of dirt from the floor.
